meanings.definition: An occasion of wild and drunken revelry.
meanings.sent1: The neighborhood block party turned into a bacchanal with loud music and dancing.
meanings.sent2: The music festival was a bacchanal of joy and celebration.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion became a bacchanal when Uncle Bob started dancing on the table.
meanings.sent4: The city streets transformed into a bacchanal of lights and laughter during the holiday season.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted a bacchanal where everyone was dancing and having a great time.

meanings.definition: A participant in a wild and drunken revelry.
meanings.sent1: At the party, he was the life of the bacchanal, dancing and laughing with everyone.
meanings.sent2: She joined the bacchanal with enthusiasm, enjoying the festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The bacchanal had many participants, all enjoying the lively music and drinks.
meanings.sent4: In the crowd, she stood out as a bacchanal, dancing freely and without inhibition.
meanings.sent5: The group of friends turned into a bacchanal, celebrating their reunion with laughter and fun.

meanings.definition: Characterized by wild and drunken revelry.
meanings.sent1: The bacchanal atmosphere at the club was infectious, with people dancing and cheering.
meanings.sent2: The street festival had a bacchanal vibe, with music blaring and people laughing.
meanings.sent3: The office party turned into a bacchanal, with colleagues letting loose and having a great time.
meanings.sent4: The carnival was a bacchanal of colors and sounds, overwhelming the senses.
meanings.sent5: The wedding reception had a bacchanal feel, with guests celebrating joyously and dancing all night.
